edu.kit.informatik.matchthree.framework

Class DeterministicStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.kit.informatik.matchthree.framework.DeterministicStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FillingStrategy

    public final class DeterministicStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements FillingStrategy
    A FillingStrategy that uses configurable Tokens as input for columns.

    An Iterator of Tokens can be set for each column. When the board is to be filled (fill(Board)), the tokens are taken from the iterator of the respective column. The filling order is deterministic. The fields are traversed starting from the bottom row to the top row and for each row from left to the right.

    Applying this strategy to the same board with the same configuration of the strategy always yields the same result.

    Author:
    IPD Koziolek

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeterministicStrategy

        @SafeVarargs
public DeterministicStrategy(java.util.Iterator<Token>... tokenIterators)
        Creates a new instance with the given token iterators.

        The iterators are assigned to the columns in the order they appear in the arguments. They must not be null.

        If no or not enough iterators are provided and the instance is used for filling without calling setTokenIteratorForColumn(int, Iterator) first for the requested columns, an exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        tokenIterators - the token iterators to use

    • Method Detail

      • setTokenIteratorForColumn

        public void setTokenIteratorForColumn(int column,
                                      java.util.Iterator<Token> nextTokens)
        Sets an Iterator of Tokens for the given column.

        Note that the tokens are taken from the iterator on demand and not buffered when calling this method. The given iterator must not return null values. If the iterator does not return a valid token for the given board when filling the board using fill(Board) or if the iterator has no next token, an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        column - the column to set the iterator for. Must be greater than or equal to zero.
        nextTokens - The iterator of tokens to use next for the given column. Must not be null.

      • fill

        public void fill(Board board)
        Description copied from interface: FillingStrategy
        Fills the playing board with Tokens. After calling this method, Board.getTokenAt(Position) returns a valid, non-null Token for every Position on the board.
        Specified by:
        fill in interface FillingStrategy
        Parameters:
        board - The board to fill with tokens. Must not be null.
